snippet: A lawyer for the man, Gerald Koch, said she believed he would be cited for contempt during a court appearance next week, an action that could put him behind bars.
abstract: Gerald Koch, 24-year-old self-described Brooklyn anarchist, may be headed to jail after refusing for the second time to testify in 2008 Times Square bombing of armed-forces recruitment center.
lead_paragraph: A lawyer for the man, Gerald Koch, said she believed he would be cited for contempt during a court appearance next week, an action that could put him behind bars.

headline.seo: Man May Face Jail for Refusing to Testify in 2008 Times Square Bomb Case
headline.main: Man May Face Jail for Refusing to Testify in Bomb Case, Again
headline.print_headline: Man May Face Jail for Refusing To Testify in Bomb Case, Again
